title: Visions_for_Immersive_Cities_NEOM_Beyond_2030
description: Each item is one atomic vision statement about immersive AI-driven cities (NEOM and beyond 2030), paraphrased from real, verifiable sources. No imaginary sources, no fabricated quotes, no duplicates.

id.description: Strictly ascending numeric ID with prefix IVIC, e.g. IVIC-000001, IVIC-000002, ... No gaps and no reuse of IDs enforced by process (not by schema).

dataset_version.description: Semantic version of the dataset at the time this record was last updated (e.g. 0.1.0).

entry_created_at.description: Timestamp when this dataset entry was created or last updated (ISO 8601).

vision_timeframe.description: Year or year range the vision refers to (e.g. '2030', '2035-2040').

vision_scope_level.description: Primary scope level of the vision.

vision_geography.description: Names of places explicitly mentioned or clearly implied (e.g. ['NEOM', 'Saudi Arabia']).

vision_scale.description: Scales at which the vision operates (e.g. ['individual', 'group', 'city']).

paraphrased_statement.description: Single, clear sentence (or short paragraph) paraphrasing the core vision in neutral language. Must be traceable to the source, no hallucinations.

source.description: Metadata about the real, verifiable source from which the vision is derived. No fabricated sources allowed.

source_type.description: Type of source. Scientific and scholarly work must use 'research_paper'. Internal texts by Martin Sambauer use 'ms_article'.

source_title.description: Title of the document, article, paper, or post.

source_author.description: Name or list of names of the author(s) if available. For anonymous texts, leave empty and use source_organization if relevant.

source_organization.description: Organisation or institution responsible for the source (e.g. NEOM, OpenAI, MIT).

source_url.description: Canonical URL of the source. Must point to a real, accessible resource.

source_publication_date.description: Date when the source was originally published (YYYY-MM-DD, best effort).

source_access_date.description: Date when the source was accessed for annotation (YYYY-MM-DD).

source_identifier.description: Optional identifier (e.g. DOI, arXiv ID, internal slug).

quoted_persons.description: Persons explicitly quoted or clearly identified as originators of the vision in the source (e.g. Elon Musk, named architects, researchers).

name.description: Full name of the quoted person.

role.description: Role or affiliation of the person at the time of the quote (e.g. 'CEO xAI', 'researcher at MIT').

ms_origin.description: Links to Martin Sambauer articles and datasets where this vision is further discussed or synthesised.

is_martin_article.description: True if the source is an article authored by Martin Sambauer.

martin_article_slug.description: Slug of the article on martin-sambauer.com, if applicable.

related_dataset_keys.description: Keys of other datasets in the repository that this entry connects to (e.g. 'SkillTaxonomy_ImmersiveCreativeRoles').

ai_layer.description: How AI appears and operates in the vision.

immersion_layer.description: How immersive media and spatial interfaces appear in the vision.

sensory_richness.description: Coarse rating of how many senses and channels the vision involves.

urban_system_function.description: Urban subsystems that the vision primarily affects.

intent_type.description: Intent of the source regarding this vision statement.

normative_evaluation.description: How the vision is framed in normative terms.

opportunity_aspects.description: Key opportunities highlighted in the source or implied by the vision.

critical_aspects.description: Key risks or critiques, e.g. privacy, surveillance, nudging.

source_confidence.description: Confidence in the reliability and relevance of the source (0–1).

paraphrase_confidence.description: Confidence that the paraphrased statement faithfully represents the source (0–1).

impact_estimates.description: Optional impact estimates for the vision.

technological_readiness_estimate.description: Estimated technological readiness of the vision (0–1).

system_transform_potential.description: Potential to transform the urban system as a whole (0–1).

adoption_timeframe_low.description: Lower bound year when the vision might realistically be adopted.

adoption_timeframe_high.description: Upper bound year when the vision might realistically be adopted.

storylines.description: Named storylines that this vision belongs to (e.g. 'city_as_conversational_partner').

semantic_anchors.description: Conceptual anchors for embeddings and agent behaviour (e.g. 'city_as_computer', 'ambient_intelligence').

topic_clusters.description: IDs of topic clusters assigned by downstream analysis (e.g. topic modelling).

source_influences.description: Optional decomposition of the vision into weighted influences from multiple sources.

source_identifier.description: Identifier or slug of a contributing source.

weight.description: Relative weight of this source in the vision statement (0–1).

skillgraph_links.description: Links to skills and roles from the immersive skillgraph.

skill_id.description: Identifier of the related skill in the skillgraph.

role_id.description: Identifier of the related role in the skillgraph.

role_label.description: Human-readable name of the role (e.g. 'Creative Director for Immersive Media').

knowledge_graph_links.description: Links to nodes in the broader knowledge graph.

counter_visions.description: Optional links to entries that explicitly contradict or challenge this vision.

id.description: ID of a related vision that acts as a counterpoint (e.g. another IVIC-xxxxx entry).
